title: Spring Onion Oil Noodles
description: Quick, fragrant noodles tossed in hot spring onion oil that blooms sweet, savory aromatics. Simple wok technique delivers glossy, flavorful strands finished with light soy and toasted sesame for a comforting, fast meal.

ingredients.display_name: fresh or dried wheat noodles (e.g., Chinese egg noodles or spaghetti)
ingredients.notes: if using dried, cook until al dente; fresh cooks faster

ingredients.display_name: spring onions (scallions), white and green parts separated
ingredients.notes: whites finely sliced, greens thinly diagonal-sliced for garnish

ingredients.display_name: neutral oil (vegetable, canola, or peanut oil)
ingredients.notes: used to make hot spring onion oil
used in oil or added to noodles depending on preference
adjust to taste, especially if soy is salty

ingredients.display_name: neutral oil for boiling water (optional splash to prevent sticking)

steps.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil and cook the noodles until just al dente; reserve about 60 ml of the cooking water, then drain the noodles.
While the noodles cook, prepare the spring onions: separate whites and greens, thinly slice the white parts and chop the green parts on the diagonal for garnish.
Combine the sliced spring onion whites and minced garlic (and ginger if using) in a heatproof bowl large enough for the noodles; set aside.

Heat the neutral oil in a small saucepan or skillet over medium-high until shimmering and just beginning to smoke; carefully pour the hot oil over the spring onion and garlic mixture to sizzle and bloom the aromatics.
In a large mixing bowl or the empty pot, combine soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, optional chili flakes, a pinch of salt, and the reserved noodle cooking water; mix to form a glossy sauce.

Add the drained hot noodles to the sauce and toss vigorously to coat evenly; pour the hot spring onion oil and aromatic solids over the noodles and toss again so the oil is distributed and the noodles shine.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional soy or salt if needed. Transfer to serving bowls and finish with chopped spring onion greens and toasted sesame seeds.
